      • id

        public static Query id(String uniParcID)
        Creates a query that searches for entries with the given UniParc identifier
        Parameters:
        uniParcID - the UniParc entry identifier example: UPI000049E5C0
        Returns:
        Query

      • accession

        public static Query accession(String accession)
        Creates a query that searches for entries that contain the given source database accession within their database cross-references.

        Note: Do not use this method to retrieve a UniParc entry that corresponds to a specific UniProt accession. It is not always guaranteed that the source database containing the accession is from UniProtKB. Instead use uniProtAccession(String) to obtain a direct mapping between the accession and a UniParc entry.

        Parameters:
        accession - a database source accession
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • uniProtAccession

        public static Query uniProtAccession(String accession)
        Creates a query that searches for entries that contain an active UniProtKB cross-reference with the given UniProt accession. Use this method to obtain a single UniParc entry for the given accession.
        Parameters:
        accession - a UniProt accession
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • database

        public static Query database(String type)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries that hold reference to at least one cross-reference of the given database type
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the database to search for
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • database

        public static Query database(DatabaseType type)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries that hold reference to at least one cross-reference of the given database type (Uses the DatabaseType enum)
        Parameters:
        type - DatabaseType to search for
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • gene

        public static Query gene(String name)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries that contain within their database cross-references the given gene name.

        The search allows you to provide partial names for searching, as long as the partial search term starts with the desired gene name, e.g. gene(HLA) will return all gene names that start with HLA, such as HLA-A or HLA-B. A minimum of 3 characters are necessary to conduct a successful search.

        Note: The vaguer the search terms the higher the amount of entries you will have to potentially process and filter out.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the gene to be searched for within the database cross-references
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • proteinName

        public static Query proteinName(String name)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries that contain within their database cross-references the given protein name.

        The search allows you to provide partial names for searching. The partial search terms can occur anywhere within the protein name.

        Note: The vaguer the search terms the higher the amount of entries you will have to potentially process and filter out.

        Parameters:
        name - the protein name to search for
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • taxonId

        public static Query taxonId(int taxId)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries that contain within their database cross-references the given taxonomic identifier.

        No partial searches are supported in this query.

        Parameters:
        taxId - an NCBI taxonomic identifier
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • organismName

        public static Query organismName(String name)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries that contain within their database cross-references the given organism name.

        The search term can be the scientific name, the common name, or a synonym.

        The query allows you to provide partial names for searching. Terms should be whole words, i.e. bact will not hit Bacteria. An organism with spaces or forward slashes are good candidates for partial searches, e.g. searching for hanedai will hit the organism name Shewanella hanedai, or searching for Yamada will hit the organism name Variola virus (isolate Human/Japan/Yamada MS-2(A)/1946) (VARV) (Smallpox virus).

        Note: The vaguer the search terms the higher the amount of entries you will have to potentially process and filter out.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the species to query
        Returns:
        a Query that will be run against the search engine

      • checksum

        public static Query checksum(String checksum)
        Creates a query that searches for UniParc entries whose sequence checksum is equal to the provided checksum.
        Parameters:
        checksum - a CRC64 checksum of a UniParc sequence
        Returns:
        a query that will be run against the search engine

      • query

        public static Query query(UniParcField.Search field,
                          String value)
        Creates a simple query on the specified search field, based on some input text.
        Parameters:
        field - the search field on which to perform the query
        value - the search term that the results must satisfy
        Returns:
        a query that will be run against the search engine

      • and

        public static Query and(Query... subQueries)
        The Query composition of the specified subQueries using 'and'.
        Parameters:
        subQueries - varargs of queries.
        Returns:
        the resulting universal conjunctive query
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - of no queries are handed to the method

      • or

        public static Query or(Query... subQueries)
        The Query composition of the specified subQueries using 'or'.
        Parameters:
        subQueries - varargs of queries.
        Returns:
        the resulting universal disjunctive query
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - of no queries are handed to the method

      • not

        public static Query not(UniParcField.Search field,
                        String value)
        Creates a query where the search field does not match the value specification.
        Parameters:
        field - the search field on which to perform the query
        value - the criteria that must not be satisfied
        Returns:
        a query that will be run against the search engine
